div.p: The default version of Erlang provided by your package manager should allow your RabbitMQ server to run, and will normally be sufficient. In all cases the minimum version required is at least R12B-3. Some functionality provided by erlang requires more recent versions.
In general use the latest non-alpha version unless you have a *really* good reason.

tr.td: Earlier versions do not support SSL well

div.p: Download a specific version of Erlang.
div.h3: Using a newer version of Erlang than the distribution repository provides

dd.p:
Due to
the EPEL package update policy, EPEL 5 contains Erlang version R12B-5, which rabbitmq-server still supports.

For better performance, and for certain non-core features (SSL support, HTTP-based plugins), use the most recent stable version of Erlang. The easiest way is to use a package repository provided by the owner of the EPEL erlang package. Enable this using (as root) wget -O /etc/yum.repos.d/epel-erlang.repo http://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/peter/erlang/epel-erlang.repo
and then install or update erlang with yum install erlang
